interlinear-text.item: I sacrifice myself for my darling 5

phrase.item: I sacrifice myself for my darling, and sacrifice myself for my nightingale.
And sacrifice [myself] for her father's house.
My darling is in Sarsin [mountain], golden binoculars in her hand.
She looks through them once to see me.
You are wearing a beauitful outfit, my poor darling.
There is nothing I can do, I sacrifice myself for her.
My darling is in a marsh, in her hand she has two round onions.
[Even] if she were to be his [someone else's] dear [nijoz- complicated way to refer to a woman who is attractive but considered hard to handle], I sacrifice myself for her.
